title.narrative: Promoting Access to Clean Energy Services

description.narrative: Reduce GHG emissions from fossil fuel-based power generation by exploiting the renewable energy resources for electricity generation in St. Vincent and the Grenadines (SVG).

title.narrative: Promoting Access to Clean Energy Services in St. Vincent and the Grenadines
Combating Climate Change through Sustainable Energy Workshop
EV and 5kW solar pv charging station Launch at the Administrative Complex
News article on the unveiling of the EV to the PM

description.narrative: The IRRF is UNDP’s results framework to monitor and report on its achievements against the Strategic Plan 2014-2017. UNDP publishes country level IRRF results that UNDP’s projects contributed to
Extent to which implementation of comprehensive measures - plans, strategies, policies, programmes and budgets - to achieve low-emission and climate-resilient development objectives has improved.

title.narrative: Access to Clean Energy St. Vin

description.narrative: The objective of the Project is to reduce GHG emissions from fossil fuel-based power generation by exploiting the renewable energy resources for electricity generation in St. Vincent and the Grenadines (SVG).

activity-description.narrative: Promoting access to clean energy services

description.narrative: Cumulative direct and direct post-project CO2 emission reductions resulting from the RE technical assistance and investments by end-of-project (EOP), ktons CO2 % share of RE in the power generation mix of SVG by EOP Number of on-grid RETs approved based on studies of improved RE policy and tariffs and RE grid integration Number of RE development project proponents that were assisted by staff from the Energy Unit and VINLEC in the technical design of their projects Number of managers in VINLEC and Energy Unit dedicated to promoting of RE investments Number of technical personnel in VINLEC, Energy Unit and in the private sector who can provide technical oversight on RE project development in SVG and other OECS countries Number of tradespersons who have local certification to construct, assemble, operate and maintain RE technologies Number of RE projects that are financed through RE funds where VINLEC has involvement in operationalization by EOP Number of privately-financed RE projects connected to VINLEC electricity grid by EOP MW of RE on-grid projects installed by EOP MW capacity of RE generation projects (on-grid and off-grid) in planning and design stages by EOP % reduction in electricity drawn from the grid for each household with on-grid rooftop solar-PV panels

comment.narrative: High relative per capita CO2 emissions Limited integration and share of RE in the power generation mix Limited penetration of RE technologies Low levels of public awareness of RE technologies Low levels of technical capacity to implement RE technology systems Limited availability of low-cost capital for RE investment

1. Implement 2 projects that are financed through RE funds where VINLEC has involvement 2. Undertake review of the macro-fiscal, technical and legal framework for RE integration 3. Undertake workshop for primary and secondary level students on RE 4. Undertake a public awareness and sensitization programme

1. The project team, together with the Energy Unit in the Ministry of National Security and VINLEC completed the installation of a 50kW solar PV system at the Belle Isle Correctional Facility in October. An assessment of the proposed site for the second solar PV system at the Argyle International Airport was undertaken in Q1 and the procurement process was launched in Q2. While the procurement of the 155kW system has been completed, the project team is awaiting confirmation from the Attorney General on the contract and from the ECCA for final approval of the proposed installation site.
2. An electric Mobility Conference was held in June to identify the scope for sustainable transport in SVG. The results of a preliminary macro-economic review were presented and regional energy stakeholders discussed the prospects for SVG to sustain electric vehicles. An international RE specialist was contracted to undertake the macro-economic analysis. Data has been collected to develop scenarios for EV uptake in SVG and recommendations for appropriate incentives.
3. The Ministry of Education in collaboration with the PACES Project would be conducting a workshop on Renewable Energy for lower level teachers that will create awareness on sustainable energy and offer valuable lessons that will instruct them on practical approaches to teaching energy topics.A suitable consultant has been selected based and is being contracted.

1. Complete 1 capacity building workshop for local and regional PV planners and financiers 2. Complete 1 capacity building programme for local PV installers and technicians 3. Complete public awareness material 4. Installation of 155kW PV system at Argyle International Airport 5. Completion of transmission lines study for geothermal electricity generation

1. A Financial Model Workshop was held on September 20 – 22, 2017. Fifty one (51) individuals attended the workshop, including representatives from financial institutions, government, project developers and local and regional energy stakeholders. The Workshop was held in collaboration with the CARICOM Secretariat and the GIZ – REETA Project.
2. Thirteen (13) individuals were trained in the area of solar PV installation and maintenance in collaboration with CARILEC. The two most promising individuals from this cohort - one from the Ministry of Transport and Works (female electrical inspectorate) and one individual from VINLEC - were selected to undertake more comprehensive PV installation and maintenance training at the Solar Energy Institute in Paonia Colorado between October and December. Upon their return, these personnel will assist with the development of a national-level programme for training technicians.
3. A thirty-minute documentary was completed, including information on the local renewable energy sector in SVG, through interviews and site visits.
4. The installation of the 155kW system was not completed due to significant administrative delays faced by local counterparts. As a result of these major delays, the project team sought and obtained an extension through 2018 to complete the major PV installations.
5. This activity faced continuous delays due to misalignment between Government and the utility. As a result, this activity was cancelled and was replaced with the implementation of an additional pilot project to install a 100kW as part of a total 500kW solar PV system being implemented on the island of Mayreau.

description.narrative: Preparation of an INDC for St. Vincent on long range planning for climate change-green economy, medium term development strategy and sustainable development aspiration.

title.narrative: Project Document Signed INDC St. Vincent and Grenadines

description.narrative: The IRRF is UNDP’s results framework to monitor and report on its achievements against the Strategic Plan 2014-2017. UNDP publishes country level IRRF results that UNDP’s projects contributed to
Extent to which implementation of comprehensive measures - plans, strategies, policies, programmes and budgets - to achieve low-emission and climate-resilient development objectives has improved.
The project shall focus on INDC preparation actions in accordance with established guidelines provided in the UNDP/World Resource Institute guidance document on Designing and Preparing an INDC.
Annual emissions of carbon dioxide (in metric tons) to be reduced or avoided described in the INDC % of electricity to be generated from renewable energy sources described in the INDC

comment.narrative: Greenhouse gas emissions 182,680tCO2e (2004) 25% of electricity generated from hydropower in 2013
Development of national monitoring, reporting and verification (MRV) system for tracking the implementation of the NDC
Multi-sector consultations underway; draft online MRV system being populated.

title.narrative: Conserving Biodiversity and ecosystem in VCT

description.narrative: To enhance biodiversity conservation and ecosystem services conservation through an expanded and strengthened PA system and with SLM measures integrated in a ridge to reef approach.
To enhance biodiversity conservation and ecosystem services conservation through an expanded and strengthened PA system and with SLM measures integrated in a ridge to reef approach.
